<Link id="l00663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="663"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If an instruction defines more than one item in the worklist, we may run</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="664"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into situations where a worklist register&#39;s value is (potentially)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="668"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This can for example occur in cases like this:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="669"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="670"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   $r1 = mov 123</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="671"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   $r0, $r1 = mvrr $r1, 456</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="672"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   call @foo, $r0, $r1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="673"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When describing $r1&#39;s value for the mvrr instruction, we need to make sure</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00675" /><CodeLine lineNumber="675"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that we don&#39;t finalize an entry value for $r0, as that is dependent on the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// previous value of $r1 (123 rather than 456).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="677"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="678"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// In order to not have to distinguish between those cases when finalizing</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="679"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// entry values, we simply postpone adding new parameter registers to the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="680"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// worklist, by first keeping them in this temporary container until the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01660" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1660"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Build the location list for all DBG&#95;VALUEs in the function that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01661" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1661"><Highlight kind="comment">/// describe the same variable. The resulting DebugLocEntries will have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01662" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1662"><Highlight kind="comment">/// strict monotonically increasing begin addresses and will never</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01663" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1663"><Highlight kind="comment">/// overlap. If the resulting list has only one entry that is valid</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01664" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1664"><Highlight kind="comment">/// throughout variable&#39;s scope return true.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1665"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1666"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See the definition of DbgValueHistoryMap::Entry for an explanation of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1667"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// different kinds of history map entries. One thing to be aware of is that if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1668"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a debug value is ended by another entry (rather than being valid until the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1669"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// end of the function), that entry&#39;s instruction may or may not be included in</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1670"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the range, depending on if the entry is a clobbering entry (it has an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1671"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instruction that clobbers one or more preceding locations), or if it is an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1672"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (overlapping) debug value entry. This distinction can be seen in the example</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1673"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// below. The first debug value is ended by the clobbering entry 2, and the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1674"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// second and third debug values are ended by the overlapping debug value entry</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01675" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1675"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 4</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1676"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01677" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1677"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Input:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01678" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1678"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01679" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1679"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   History map entries &#91;type, end index, mi&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01680" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1680"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01681" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1681"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 0 |      &#91;DbgValue, 2, DBG&#95;VALUE $reg0, &#91;...&#93; (fragment 0, 32)&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01682" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1682"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 | |    &#91;DbgValue, 4, DBG&#95;VALUE $reg1, &#91;...&#93; (fragment 32, 32)&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01683" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1683"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 | |    &#91;Clobber, $reg0 = &#91;...&#93;, -, -&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01684" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1684"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 3   | |  &#91;DbgValue, 4, DBG&#95;VALUE 123, &#91;...&#93; (fragment 64, 32)&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01685" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1685"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 4        &#91;DbgValue, ~0, DBG&#95;VALUE @g, &#91;...&#93; (fragment 0, 96)&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1686"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1687"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Output &#91;start, end) &#91;Value...&#93;:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1688"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1689"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;0-1)    &#91;(reg0, fragment 0, 32)&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1690"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;1-3)    &#91;(reg0, fragment 0, 32), (reg1, fragment 32, 32)&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1691"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;3-4)    &#91;(reg1, fragment 32, 32), (123, fragment 64, 32)&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1692"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#91;4-)     &#91;(@g, fragment 0, 96)&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2334"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DwarfDebug::findForceIsStmtInstrs(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &#42;MF) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2336"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2337"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For this function, we try to find MBBs where the last source line in every</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2338"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// block predecessor matches the first line seen in the block itself; for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2339"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// every such MBB, we set is&#95;stmt=false on the first line in the block, and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2340"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for every other block we set is&#95;stmt=true on the first line.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2341"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For example, if we have the block %bb.3, which has 2 predecesors %bb.1 and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2342"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// %bb.2:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2343"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   bb.1:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2344"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     $r3 = MOV64ri 12, debug-location !DILocation(line: 4)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2345"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     JMP %bb.3, debug-location !DILocation(line: 5)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2346"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   bb.2:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2347"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     $r3 = MOV64ri 24, debug-location !DILocation(line: 5)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2348"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     JMP %bb.3</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2349"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   bb.3:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2350"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     $r2 = MOV64ri 1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02351" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2351"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     $r1 = ADD $r2, $r3, debug-location !DILocation(line: 5)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02352" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2352"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// When we examine %bb.3, we first check to see if it contains any</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02353" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2353"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions with debug locations, and select the first such instruction;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2354"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in this case, the ADD, with line=5. We then examine both of its</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2355"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predecessors to see what the last debug-location in them is. For each</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2356"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// predecessor, if they do not contain any debug-locations, or if the last</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02693" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2693"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Public name handling.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02694" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2694"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The format for the various pubnames:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02695" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2695"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02696" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2696"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// dwarf pubnames - offset/name pairs where the offset is the offset into the CU</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02697" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2697"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for the DIE that is named.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02698" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2698"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02699" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2699"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// gnu pubnames - offset/index value/name tuples where the offset is the offset</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02700" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2700"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// into the CU and the index value is computed according to the type of value</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02701" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2701"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for the DIE that is named.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02702" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2702"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02703" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2703"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For type units the offset is the offset of the skeleton DIE. For split dwarf</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02704" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2704"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// it&#39;s the offset within the debug&#95;info/debug&#95;types dwo section, however, the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02705" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2705"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// reference in the pubname header doesn&#39;t change.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02706" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2706"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02707" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2707"><Highlight kind="comment">/// computeIndexValue - Compute the gdb index value for the DIE and CU.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2708" lineLink="#a4a6055a40e65d2916f98811698ce5b4f"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/dwarf/pubindexentrydescriptor">dwarf::PubIndexEntryDescriptor</a> <a href="#a4a6055a40e65d2916f98811698ce5b4f">computeIndexValue</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dwarfunit-2">DwarfUnit</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/cu">CU</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2710"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Entities that ended up only in a Type Unit reference the CU instead (since</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2711"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the pub entry has offsets within the CU there&#39;s no real offset that can be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2712"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// provided anyway). As it happens all such entities (namespaces and types,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2713"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// types only in C++ at that) are rendered as TYPE+EXTERNAL. If this turns out</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2714"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// not to be true it would be necessary to persist this information from the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2715"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// point at which the entry is added to the index data structure - since by</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2716"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the time the index is built from that, the original type/namespace DIE in a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2717"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// type unit has already been destroyed so it can&#39;t be queried for properties</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
